content.description: A really clean slab line following the obvious crack. The crux is the top out, you really have to trust your foot.
content.protection: A few pads and good spotters, the landing is on a hill.
content.location: Start in the lower section of the obvious crack and work your way left to a top out over the arete.

content.description: Start on decent jug in the center of the steep side of boulder, move up into a deep crimp in the bottom of the thin finger crack. Make a big move, following the direction of the finger crack, onto a good hold on the lip of the boulder. Mantle.
content.location: The boulder itself is about 1.5 miles into the trail. You will pass directly next to it. Look for a boulder with slab on one side and a huge shelf on the other. The start is just to the left of the large and obvious shelf.

content.description: Start on the Juicy Sweatpants start hold, move left onto a series of decent crimps. Crux move is transitioning from these crimps onto the larger flakes that you will use to top out.
content.protection: Good landing zone, 1 or 2 pads will do
content.location: Same start as Juicy Sweatpants, just to the left of the large obvious shelf. Works diagonally left and tops out on the left-most prow of the boulder.

content.description: A collection of 3 or so nice boulders with lots of potential for fun new lines. Only a few have been climbed as of Oct. 2021. The largest and best quality boulder in this area is found about halfway up the mountain and has a large slab side as well as a steeper more powerful side.
